Description: Black-topped vase of Nile silt pottery with a flat base, convex walls and small lip rim, badly chipped, coated with red slip, blackened at rim and upper body, and burnished. Lightly incised curved line on side may be a potmark.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Identified as Black-topped red ware B56 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery by E. Baumgartel in Petrie’s Naqada Excavations: A Supplement (London 1970), p. xliv. Marked 1474 on base.
